page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: OLD BUILDINGS IN WINCHESTER As Winchester is an{ancient}capital it has lots of{local history}and is strewn with old{buildings.}An example is the hospital with its endless Victorian brickwork using burnt black as well as ordinary bricks.Another old building is King Alfred's College.It is quite different from the hospital because it uses stone instead of bricks. At the top of the building there are many gargoyles which look as if they are just about to jump out at you. It would seem as if most of the old buildings in this area are Victorian. The teacher's centre is about the same age as the hospital, with similar brickwork. It has not always been a teacher's centre. It was built as a school and was used as this until the new Western school was built 10 years ago.
